item.title: Where do you spend your money? Tell us
item.description: We are keen to understand how the cost of living is being felt across Australia. What are your biggest expenses? Are you making cutbacks? Do you afford yourself luxuries?

item.title: Josh Hazlewood to miss start of T20 World Cup, Mitch Marsh shrugs off Pakistan loss
item.description: Speedster Josh Hazlewood will miss the early stages of the T20 World Cup as captain Mitch Marsh shrugs off Australia's lamentable capitulations in their warm-up series in Pakistan.

item.title: More children suffering serious injuries on e-scooters, study shows
item.description: Between 2021 and 2024, e-scooter injury-related admissions at Queensland Children's Hospital more than doubled, the study found, with young boys accounting for three-quarters of admissions, with a median age of 13.

item.title: Sita Walker's debut novel, In a Common Hour, takes place across a single hour at a state high school
item.description: Sita Walker, an English teacher from Brisbane, explains how she tackled her first work of fiction, set in a single hour at a state high school.

item.title: Spanish figure skater Tomas-Llorenc Guarino Sabate says Minions music barred due to copyright issue
item.description: Spanish figure skater Tomas-Llorenc Guarino Sabate says he will not be allowed to use the music from the Minions film franchise that he has skated to throughout the season at the Milano Cortina Games due to a copyright clearance issue.

item.title: Belinda Bencic and Elina Svitolina make history as two mothers sit in WTA top 10 for the first time
item.description: For the first time in women's tennis, two mothers are ranked inside the world's top 10 simultaneously.

item.title: Christmas Island Flying Fox
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Sam Kerr is back for the Asian Cup, half a lifetime after winning it as a teenager
item.description: Matildas captain Sam Kerr was just 16 when she helped the team win the Women's Asian Cup — their first, and to date only major trophy. Now she's leading the side at home, ready for another shot at glory.

item.title: Wallabies Rugby World Cup matches revealed against All Blacks, Hong Kong China and Chile
item.description: Australia's home Rugby World Cup campaign will kick off against debutants Hong Kong China rather than bitter rivals New Zealand, who also feature in the same pool.

item.title: Nusantara Beat to bring 'psychedelic' take on Indonesian folk music to WOMADelaide
item.description: All members of Amsterdam-based band Nusantara Beat have Indonesian heritage, so what better way to connect with those roots than through a very different take on the archipelago's traditional music?

item.title: Queensland land activation program lacks affordable homes mandate
item.description: There are no mandates for social or affordable homes in the Queensland state government's latest action to address the housing crisis.

item.title: RBA lifts interest rates by 0.25pc as inflation rises
item.description: RBA lifts interest rates by 0.25 per cent, to 3.85 per cent, after inflation rose "materially" in the second half of 2025.

item.title: South Sydney recruit David Fifita will lean on Wayne Bennett in an effort to rebuild his NRL career
item.description: After a season lost to injury, newly minted South Sydney backrower David Fifita will lean on Rabbitohs coach Wayne Bennett in an effort to reclaim his status as one of the NRL's most dangerous players.

item.title: Perth man accused of backing Bondi attackers facing more firearms charges
item.description: A Perth man who allegedly stated support for the Bondi shooters appears in court to face new firearms charges, with his lawyer flagging a bail application.

item.title: Austin Appelbee speaks after 'superhuman' swim off Quindalup to save family in Geographe Bay
item.description: A WA mother says asking her teenage son to swim 4 kilometres through rough seas to get help after their family was swept out to sea, was "one of the hardest decisions" she has ever made.

item.title: Central Coast Mariners star Annalise Rasmussen signs with Italian powerhouse Juventus
item.description: A-League leading goal scorer Annalise Rasmussen leaves the competition immediately to join Italian powerhouse Juventus.

item.title: French police raid X offices in Paris as Elon Musk ordered to face questions
item.description: A widening probe into the social media platform is investigating alleged abuse of algorithms and fraudulent data extraction.

item.title: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez announces plans to ban social media access for under-16s
item.description: The Spanish PM said his government would begin the process of passing legislation from as early as next week.

item.title: Poland to probe links between Epstein and Russian intelligence
item.description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk says the step has been taken amid growing speculation that "this unprecedented paedophilia scandal was co-organised by Russian intelligence services".

item.title: UK police open criminal investigation into politician Peter Mandelson over links to Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: The former UK ambassador to the US will retire from Britain's parliament as police open a criminal investigation over his ties to the late paedophile.

item.title: Officers find signs of forced entry at home of TV host Savannah Guthrie's mother
item.description: Investigators reportedly found evidence of a deliberate night-time kidnapping at the property.

item.title: What could the government do to help battle inflation?
item.description: The federal government has a variety of options available if it wants to do more to stave off inflation, but none are popular.

item.title: Elite women athletes finding ways to work smarter, to help sporting and professional careers
item.description: The sport-work-life balance is a struggle faced by many female athletes, but many are finding meaningful ways to diversify their income to secure their future.

item.title: SA Liberals face three major threats in One Nation, a popular premier and independents
item.description: While South Australia is considered a more moderate state than Queensland or New South Wales, March's state election will still be a chance to gauge the seriousness of One Nation's polling surge and the impact of the Coalition split on the Liberal Party's brand.

item.title: Brisbane 2032 looking to learn from Milano Cortina Olympics as costs of dispersed Games start to bite
item.description: Brisbane 2032 president Andrew Liveris says the bid budget "bears no resemblance to reality" as the financial impact of a dispersed Olympics hits home.

item.title: Police search for two men who slashed teen and ran him over in St Kilda
item.description: Several men described by police as acting like "rabid dogs" are on the run after allegedly slashing a teenager with a knife and running him over in an incident in Melbourne on Tuesday night.

item.title: Otways residents burnt out of their 'paradise' determined to rebuild home
item.description: The Cochrane family has called the Otways home for more than four decades. Even after fires destroyed their property, they do not plan to move.

item.title: Australia knocked out of under-19 Cricket World Cup by England
item.description: Ollie Peake's hobbling and defiant captain's knock of 100 has proved too little too late to rescue Australia as their reign as under-19 World Cup champions was ended by England in a compelling semifinal in Zimbabwe.

item.title: Greens link Hospitality Tasmania's donations to Liberals to pokies card demise
item.description: The Tasmanian Greens have accused the state's peak hospitality group and the Liberal Party of a "political stitch-up" to kill off the proposed mandatory pokies card, after hundreds of thousands of dollars in donations were revealed.

item.title: Randa Abdel-Fattah to appear at one-off Adelaide literary festival Constellations
item.description: Palestinian Australian author, lawyer and activist Randa Abdel-Fattah will be appearing at the one-off literary event created to fill the void left by the cancellation of this year's Adelaide Writers' Week, organisers have announced.

item.title: Queensland Police appeal for information as search continues for missing 70-year-old Dawn Wells
item.description: A large-scale search operation is underway south of Brisbane as police intensify efforts to locate a "beloved community member" who went missing late last year.

item.title: Four new rule changes announced for the 2026 NRL season, kick-off tweak to be trialled
item.description: A proposed rule change to the rugby league kick-off will not be enforced at the start of the 2026 NRL season and will instead be trialled during matches later in the year.

item.title: Drought-affected SA farmers able to access low-interest loans of up to $250,000
item.description: The SA government has stepped in with an "unprecedented" offer of direct low-interest loans to farmers hit hard by years of drought.

item.title: Demons defender Steven May misses AFL pre-season training
item.description: Melbourne Demons veteran Steven May was not at training for his club on Wednesday, just six weeks out from the start of the 2026 AFL season.

item.title: Art exhibitions to see this summer, from Ron Mueck to Hobart Current and Olafur Eliasson
item.description: From Aussie expat Ron Mueck's hyper-realistic sculptures and Icelandic Danish artist Olafur Eliasson's thought-provoking installations to the best contemporary artists in Tasmania, here are three exhibitions to see.

item.title: Diamonds eye timely glimpse of Jamaica in Test series ahead of Commonwealth Games
item.description: Australia's netballers expect to gain precious intelligence ahead of a showpiece tournament when they host Jamaica in a three-Test series.

item.title: $15b National Reconstruction Fund allowed to back 'losers' in push to cut emissions
item.description: The $15 billion fund will be allowed to back riskier green projects under new rules announced today.

item.title: Police lecture teen caught driving 189km/h on Sunshine Motorway at midnight
item.description: The teenager on his P-plates was pulled over by police along a Sunshine Coast motorway driving at almost 200km/h.

item.title: Trump's failure to extend nuclear treaty leaves door 'wide open' to arms race
item.description: The last remaining nuclear arms pact between the United States and Russia has come to an end at a time of global instability.

item.title: Humpty Doo locals help relocate crocodile from side of highway
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Banned tennis player Thomas Fancutt makes comeback after IV vitamin breach
item.description: Thomas Fancutt has made his return to professional tennis after receiving a 10-month ban for a vitamin and magnesium infusion.

item.title: Why these women took marriage sabbaticals — and how it went
item.description: Do you ever feel like taking a break from your marriage? Three women share how a marriage sabbatical changed their relationship.

item.title: Mother issues urgent appeal as WA Police call off search for missing son, Zjaequaan Sebasio
item.description: Zjaequaan Sebasio's family and WA Police are urging anyone with information about his location to come forward, after his disappearance almost a week ago.

item.title: Daly River residents being evacuated to Darwin ahead of predicted major flooding
item.description: About 450 people are being evacuated from the remote Northern Territory town of Daly River, ahead of expected flood levels of more than 14 metres.

item.title: K'gari traditional owners hold smoking ceremony for Piper James on beach where she died
item.description: K'gari traditional owners have held a smoking ceremony for Piper James, who died on the island last month, to give her spirit a safe passage home.

item.title: Second inquest wraps up into the disappearance of escort Revelle Balmain at Kingsford in 1994
item.description: An inquest has wrapped up into the disappearance of Sydney escort Revelle Balmain, 31 years after she was reported missing.

item.title: Austin Appelbee's incredible tale of survival has made international headlines. How did the 13yo do it?
item.description: Austin Appelbee, 13, has made international headlines after swimming for four hours in rough seas to save his mum, sister and brother stranded in the ocean. How did he do it?

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Labor MP Ed Husic 'uncomfortable' with Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit
item.description: Labor's Ed Husic says it is "hard to reconcile" a visit by Israeli President Isaac Herzog with comments he has made in relation to the war in Gaza.

item.title: 'Bloodbath' at Washington Post as massive layoffs announced
item.description: The Jeff Bezos-owned paper, which famously brought down US President Richard Nixon, will drastically cut back in size and lay off workers in all its departments.

item.title: Attorney-General asked anti-corruption chief to explain himself after Defence ties emerged
item.description: Attorney-General Michelle Rowland asked Paul Brereton to explain why his ongoing ties to Defence had not been "adequately" disclosed in a letter sent last year.

item.title: Report points to exploitation, Medicare and visa concerns in Pacific islander jobs scheme
item.description: Changing jobs is a basic right for most people, but it is not so simple for Pacific Australia Labour Mobility workers.

item.title: In Zak Hilditch's horror movie We Bury the Dead, the zombie apocalypse devastates Tasmania
item.description: These Final Hours writer and director Zak Hilditch drew on personal tragedy to produce We Bury the Dead, his biggest cinematic epic yet.

item.title: Fears SA's endangered glossy black-cockatoo eggs will 'cook' in nesting boxes during heatwave
item.description: South Australia's population of a unique subspecies of glossy black-cockatoos is heavily dependent on artificial nesting boxes. That could pose a problem during extreme heat conditions.

item.title: Parramatta Eels veteran Josh Addo-Carr urges young teammates to step up after Zac Lomax depature
item.description: Parramatta's next generation of outside backs must step up if they are to fill the void left by Zac Lomax, his ex-teammate Josh Addo-Carr has said.

item.title: Two months since the social media ban began and teens say it isn't working
item.description: Australia's world-first social media ban for under-16s is two months old, but teenagers say they have found ways around it.

item.title: Welfare concerns for missing man Luke Hazelwood last seen outside of Lancelin Sands Hotel
item.description: Luke Hazelwood was last seen outside the Lancelin Sands Hotel on December 24, but his family are holding out hope for his safe return.

item.title: Donald Trump, gold, interest rates and AI data centres to dominate company reporting season
item.description: Australia's mining sector is expected to lead the earnings charge for this reporting season, boosted by signs of a stabilisation in the Chinese economy and a turbo-charged commodities market.

item.title: Worker's death at Tanami gold mine in Central Australia under investigation
item.description: A 47-year-old worker has died following an incident at the Tanami gold mine in remote Central Australia, with police and NT WorkSafe investigating.

item.title: Police executing drug raid find deadly snakes, crocodile in alleged makeshift zoo
item.description: More than 50 reptiles, including a 1.3-metre crocodile, have been seized after police discovered an alleged makeshift zoo during a drug raid on the NSW Mid North Coast.

item.title: Gus disappearance declared major crime, suspect identified
item.description: South Australian police have declared the disappearance of Gus Lamont a major crime and say a person who has lived at his outback property is now considered a suspect, but have stressed that the boy's parents are not under investigation.

item.title: Invasion Day bomb declared terror act, as accused's 'pro-white ideology' probed
item.description: The attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally in Perth's CBD last week is declared a terrorist attack by authorities.

item.title: Union calls for urgent response after Ashley Youth Detention Centre staff hospitalised
item.description: A union claims management at Tasmania's youth prison did not follow its own short-staffing policy, despite an incident occurring only a day after workers took strike action due to safety concerns.

item.title: Strict caps on bottled water extraction urged for World Heritage-listed Springbrook
item.description: A long-awaited study warns that the extraction of bottled water from the World Heritage-listed Springbrook area poses a potential risk to the ancient Gondwana rainforests and should be strictly limited.

item.title: Private health insurers take aim at rising specialists fees
item.description: A survey of 4,000 patients finds more than half had an unexpected cost when under a specialist's care.

item.title: AFL integrity unit looking into why police visited Melbourne Demons player Steven May
item.description: Melbourne veteran Steven May is being investigated by the AFL integrity unit, as the premiership defender stays away from Demons training.

item.title: ACTU pushing 'above-inflation' wage increase in 2026 as real paypackets decline
item.description: Australia's biggest employers are under pressure to give their workers pay increases above 4 per cent this year, as real wages go backwards and the union movement ramps up pressure.

item.title: Andrew Hastie reads Art of War, Pauline Hanson returns
item.description: The calamity unfolding in the dissolved Coalition provided a convenient distraction for the government, which should have had a worse week amid an interest rate hike.

item.title: More than 200 Daly River residents evacuated amid flood threat, with most staying at Darwin's Foskey Pavilion
item.description: Hundreds of Daly River residents have been evacuated to Darwin ahead of expected major flooding, with Foskey Pavilion set up to accommodate most of the evacuees.

item.title: NSW government contacts Newcastle Writers Festival about author Randa Abdel-Fattah's inclusion
item.description: The NSW government makes contact with the board of next month's Newcastle Writers Festival about the inclusion of Palestinian-Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah, the ABC understands.

item.title: Albanese, Ley condemn alleged act of terror targeting Indigenous protesters
item.description: The prime minister and opposition leader have both condemned the alleged attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally more than a week ago, after police revealed it was being prosecuted as a terror incident.

item.title: Today show host Savannah Guthrie asks for proof her mother is alive in social media video
item.description: The Today show host releases a video on Instagram asking for proof her mother is still alive.

item.title: Democrat victory in Republican stronghold could spell trouble for Trump
item.description: The US has been gripped by cold weather in recent weeks, but pundits say it is in Texas where hell has truly frozen over. A blue wave just swept a GOP stronghold, and Republicans are very worried.

item.title: What will happen to the land from the sale of Perth's Irwin and Leeuwin barracks, and where will the money go?
item.description: The planned sale of the Irwin and Leeuwin barracks in Perth will see dozens of hectares of potentially prime residential land hit the market. So is it likely to be used for housing, and what difference will it really make?

item.title: Gus Lamont disappearance from Oak Park Station near Yunta: What has happened so far
item.description: It is now more than four months since Gus Lamont went missing from his family's home in South Australia's outback, with the case being declared a major crime on Thursday. Here's what has happened so far.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Nationals issue Ley with reunion counteroffer as deadline looms
item.description: The minor party has given the opposition leader terms that one Nationals MP said they did "not expect" would be acceptable in what has been described as a bid to push out her self-imposed deadline.

item.title: Diamonds defeat Jamaica in first netball Test match in Adelaide
item.description: The Diamonds made a flying start with the initial six goals in a comprehensive 72-41 victory at the Adelaide Entertainment Centre.

item.title: Russian captain of cargo ship Solong jailed over fatal North Sea collision
item.description: A judge describes Vladimir Motin as "an accident waiting to happen" as he hands the Russian national a six-year jail term.

item.title: New study reveals how stressful footy fandom can be
item.description: A new study reveals how much high-stakes sporting events can get the heart pumping by strapping trackers to over 200 German football fans.

item.title: Today in history, February 6: The Manchester United team that perished in the Munich air disaster of 1958
item.description: On a snowy February afternoon in 1958, the football team that many were calling the greatest that Britain had ever produced stopped to refuel at Munich Airport. The plane would never take off, and the Flowers of Manchester would take years to bloom again.

item.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese signs security treaty with Indonesia
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has travelled to Jakarta to sign the treaty, which the Australian government calls the "biggest step" the countries have taken together in 30 years.

item.title: Former attorney-general Mark Dreyfus warned anti-corruption chief to 'manage' or 'avoid' conflicts
item.description: A letter from Mark Dreyfus to Paul Brereton provides new insight into the expectations set for the inaugural chief of the anti-corruption watchdog.

item.title: Effect of capital gains tax changes on housing affordability likely depends on design
item.description: Labor has not ruled out changes to the capital gains tax discount but wants any tax changes to improve housing affordability.

item.title: Jim Chalmers's appetite for economic reform is about to be tested
item.description: Jim Chalmers could face his biggest test yet as treasurer over the next few months.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: When does it start, how to watch and who is competing in which sports
item.description: Australia is tipped for enormous success over the next couple of weeks so now might be a good time to clue yourself up. Here's everything you need to know about the 2026 Winter Games.

item.title: US hopes to challenge China's critical minerals dominance with new trading bloc
item.description: The US is urging dozens of countries to follow Australia's lead and sign on to a plan to stop relying on China for the critical minerals used in modern technology.

item.title: What Israel's President Isaac Herzog has said about Gaza, and why he won't be arrested in Australia
item.description: When Israel's president lands in Australia this weekend, he can expect an official red carpet treatment. But he will be all too aware of the controversy his visit is generating.

item.title: ATO debt continues to drive record level of calls to small business financial helpline
item.description: Financial counsellors say small businesses struggling to pay debts owed to the tax office are driving calls to Australia's Small Business Debt Helpline higher.

item.description: US investigators believe the missing mother of Today show host Savannah Guthrie is "still out there" despite having no proof she is still alive.

item.description: The Nationals have proposed spending another two weeks in exile from the frontbench rather than address the Liberals' non-negotiable conditions for a Coalition reunion.

item.description: Royal Challengers Bengaluru pulled off the biggest successful chase in the Women's Premier League to win their second title in the Indian franchise-based T20 league.

item.description: Locals, the council and a Queensland MP are questioning the wisdom of a Queensland government plan to build dwellings in an area of Burketown known to flood.

item.description: A "judgement call" about a permanent commercial fishing ban for demersal species went further than the advice handed to her, WA's Fisheries Minister Jackie Jarvis says.

item.description: Premier Roger Cook writes to the 13-year-old, who made international headlines after swimming 4 kilometres in rough seas to raise the alarm and save his family.

item.description: Prosecutors have abandoned a drug trafficking case against underworld figure Tony Mokbel following his release from prison last year.

item.description: The two-time winner of Australia's Best Takeaway Fish and Chips says it has been forced to increase prices considerably following Western Australia's demersal fishing reforms.

item.description: By the end of 2026 the WA government and Woodside will have spent over $93 million on Roebourne District High School and its 141 enrolled students. But last year only one in four upper school students attended.

item.description: Commercial fishers are hopeful for an abundance of barramundi after heavy rainfall from ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji on the east coast and ongoing flooding in the Gulf of Carpentaria.

item.description: The man accused of a one-punch attack on former Labor strategist Tim Picton, who died in hospital last month, has his charge upgraded to manslaughter.

item.description: The festival's director said Dr Abdel-Fattah was invited in August last year and denied the state government pressured her to remove the writer.

item.description: Tasmania Police will again head into thick bushland to continue searching for more items in the area where Belgian tourist Celine Cremer vanished in 2023 — after the shock discovery of bones last week.

item.description: Some long-term residents have decided to stay behind in Daly River to help amid impending major flooding, after more than 200 people were evacuated to Darwin.

item.description: Josh Hazlewood is ruled out of Australia's T20 World Cup campaign as he continues to recover from the injuries which kept him from playing in the summer's Ashes series.

item.title: Small plane crashes in Normanton, north-west Queensland, starting grass fire and knocking out power
item.description: Only the pilot was on board, police said, adding that his injuries remain unknown and that the response to the incident is ongoing.

item.title: Daisy Thomas, competing without an ACL, suffers heavy crash at Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Australian freestyle skier Daisy Thomas, who is competing at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games without an ACL, suffers a heavy fall in slopestyle training and has withdrawn from the event to focus on big air.

item.description: As another T20 World Cup sneaks up on us, here's everything you need to know about the tournament, including a guide on how to pick which team to support, depending on your needs.

item.description: The 14-year-old prodigy Vaibhav Sooryavanshi breaks Alyssa Healy's record with the highest score ever in a World Cup final to power India to the global under-19 crown.

item.title: Adelaide Festival leader Julian Hobba reflects on Writers' Week controversy
item.description: As Adelaide Writers' Week went up in flames, Julian Hobba contemplated resigning as Adelaide Festival's executive director. He now says "we needed to trust the judgement" of the literary event's former leader, Louise Adler.

item.title: Collision sport Run Nation Championship in Sydney sells 5,000 tickets despite head injury concerns
item.description: The Run Nation Championship will see two athletes run at each other, in a sport criticised for its head injury risks. Organisers argue the championship has been professionalised, and will grow to be as big as boxing.

item.description: Disturbing new details emerge about the 2023 stabbing death of a woman in her Bruce home as her former partner faces sentencing for her murder in the ACT Supreme Court.

item.description: One of three people who died in a light plane crash south of Adelaide has been identified as an experienced pilot.

item.title: Easy homemade granola that will last you weeks - ABC News
item.description: When it comes to batch cooking, don't forget breakfast. This granola can make mornings easier and will last weeks.

item.title: Nancy Guthrie may have been abducted in a 41-minute window, authorities say
item.description: Nancy Guthrie was last seen alive when a relative dropped her outside her Tucson home after a family games night. The 84-year-old grandmother has now been missing for a week.

item.title: Fires in Mudgegonga
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Wodonga Hume Freeway bushfire February 1
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Dashcam footage shows beginnings of spotfires
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Lithium-ion battery fires prompt new waste collection program in North Queensland
item.description: Authorities say crews responded to 260 lithium-ion battery fires in Queensland last year. A new waste collection program in the state's north aims to prevent them.

item.title: What is the AIN at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics? Why Russian and Belarusian athletes are allowed to compete in Italy
item.description: The Winter Olympics of Milano Cortina 2026 is another where Russian and Belarusian athletes will be largely absent, although there are a handful competing as individual neutral athletes.

item.title: Trump endorses Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi ahead of Japan's election
item.description: One of Sanae Takaichi's first engagements after she was elevated to prime minister in October was to host Donald Trump in Tokyo.

item.title: Family from Netherlands calls for change after 27yo dies of suspected heatstroke in remote WA
item.description: Tiffani Phelps de Wildt died after collapsing on a remote station in WA's north. Her family says, had they known the risks, they would have tried to stop her from going out in the heat.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 opening ceremony quick hits: Mariah Carey and Valentino Rossi ignite an historic evening as Snoop Dogg makes an appearance
item.description: Athletes parade across Italy, Mariah Carey ignites a historic evening, and 'Coach Snoop' makes an appearance at the curling. Here are the quick hits from the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics opening ceremony.

item.title: Why 13yo Austin Appelbee's story of survival resonated so strongly across the globe
item.description: The remarkable story of Austin Appelbee's marathon swim for help went around the world, so why did it spark such an emotional reaction?

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 1, Saturday, February 7
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan today.

item.title: Accused militant in deadly 2012 Benghazi attack on US compound taken into custody in United States
item.description: Zubayar Al-Bakoush, 58, has been wanted by the United States for more than a decade for his alleged role in the attack, which killed four Americans, including the US ambassador to Libya.

item.title: Police given additional powers as NSW premier calls for calm during Israeli presidential visit
item.description: NSW Premier Chris Minns has told demonstrators planning to protest Israel President Isaac Herzog's visit to Sydney that there should be "no clashes or violence".

item.title: Donald Trump's rare backdown on racist Obama post shows even the 'Teflon president' has limits
item.description: Donald Trump has, until now, thrived in controversy. But the US president has now done something that a year ago would have been unthinkable: deleted a social media post.

item.title: The Mark of Cain lead singer on a lifetime masking the truth
item.description: The lead singer of legendary Adelaide rockers The Mark of Cain this week announced she was transgender, but it comes after nearly 60 years of hiding the truth from everyone.

item.title: Thailand election stakes are high as progressives mount new challenge against establishment
item.description: As Thailand prepares to head to the polls, voters remain wary that in their version of democracy, the party they vote for is not always the one that takes power.

item.title: What you need to know about skiing in Japan and how to keep yourself safe on the slopes
item.description: Australians flock to Japan each year to take advantage of its unique and plentiful snow, but it's not just the travel costs that are mounting.

item.title: Luigi Mangione speaks out against prospect of back-to-back trials over Brian Thompson's killing
item.description: Accused killer has spoken out in court against the prospect of back-to-back trials over the shooting of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, telling a judge "it's the same trial twice".

item.title: Mayor of flood-hit Daly region accuses governments of inaction over long-term planning
item.description: The Northern Territory and federal governments are being accused of failing to plan long term to protect Indigenous communities in the Victoria Daly region.

item.title: Latest Epstein files documents reveal links to multiple monarchies
item.description: The latest release of the so-called Epstein files has revealed the convicted child sex offender was in contact with members of — and people close to — monarchies across Europe and the Middle East.

item.title: What our teeth reveal about the growing gap between rich and poor
item.description: Teeth are one of the most visible markers of poverty: structural circumstances that are individually borne.

item.title: Why Wests Tigers hopeful Pat Herbert jumped off an excavator and into an NRL pre-season
item.description: After three years away from first grade, Pat Herbert was ready to get on with the rest of his life but a call from Wests Tigers got him off the job site and into an NRL pre-season.

item.title: Colorado funeral home owner sentenced over nearly 200 counts of corpse abuse
item.description: A funeral home owner who stashed 189 decomposing bodies in a building over four years and gave grieving families fake ashes has been sentenced to 40 years in prison.

item.title: Aussie snowboarder Guseli finishes outside medals at Winter Olympics
item.description: Australia's Valentino Guseli falls short of reaching the podium in the men's snowboard big air final on day one of the Milano Cortino Winter Olympics.

item.title: US gives Russia and Ukraine a June deadline to reach a deal to end the war
item.description: America has given Russia and Ukraine a June deadline to end the war — and will put pressure on both sides to ensure it is met — Volodymyr Zelenskyy says.

item.title: How the Liberals will justify Sussan Ley's ousting
item.description: A permission structure has been crafted for Liberals to ditch the first woman to lead the federal party room before she has even had a year in the role.

item.title: If you could learn your baby's genetic disease risk at birth, would you?
item.description: From rare cancers caught early to dementia foretold decades in advance, newborn genomic testing raises an unsettling question: Just because we can know, should we?

item.title: Xavier Rudd on visiting Echuca, playing solo, and the spiritual being that follows him
item.description: Xavier Rudd performs solo these days, but he carries a spirit with him wherever he goes.

item.title: Hard Quiz: You'll do badly, but don't let that stop you from trying
item.description: I'm honestly surprised you're back. I genuinely didn't expect to see you so soon after last week's dismal effort.

item.title: Big swings in Australia's electricity market have a frustrating effect on our power bills
item.description: The benefits of extremely low energy prices during the day are "washed away" by extremely high ones after dark. But there is light at the end of the tunnel.

item.title: $203 million crackdown on dodgy doctors and advocates targeting veterans
item.description: Fraudsters taking advantage of people with disability now appear to be targeting veterans, prompting a $200 million crackdown by the federal government.

item.title: After the uprising, Bangladesh returns to the ballot with its wounds still open
item.description: Bangladesh is heading back to the ballot box in what is being billed as its first free and fair election in more than a decade.

item.title: In rare interview, World Safari documentary-maker Alby Mangels reveals why he 'disappeared'
item.description: In the 1980s, Alby Mangels was a box office star. The filmmaker wowed Australian audiences with his exotic adventures, but at the height of his fame he disappeared. In a rare interview he reveals what went wrong.

item.title: Why gen Zs on social media are having 'a very Chinese time in my life'
item.description: Some Chinese Australians have mixed feelings about the sudden global embrace of Chinese culture after the trend emerged late last year.

item.title: Illegal e-bikes to be seized and destroyed in major New South Wales crackdown
item.description: Devices found to be going over the state's e-bike speed limit will be seized and destroyed by authorities, under expanded police powers.

item.title: How Super Bowl half-time moments became flashpoints from the 'wardrobe malfunction' to caged kids
item.description: For a show that lasts roughly 13 minutes, the Super Bowl half-time performance has fuelled decades of conversation.

item.title: Outreach workers raced against time to warn homeless people of bushfires
item.description: In the days leading up to an extreme heatwave hitting Victoria, outreach workers raced against time to alert as many rough sleepers in bushland as possible.

item.title: Australia's men and women unbeaten in Perth Sevens to set up semifinal opportunities
item.description: Australia makes a hot start to the Rugby Sevens in Perth, with both the men's and women's teams going unbeaten in securing semifinal berths.

item.title: As the West wakes up to the reality of the Epstein class, China plans a global reserve currency
item.description: As the West reacts to the revelations in the latest batch of Epstein files, China has plans for the renminbi to become a global reserve currency.

item.title: United States send India a T20 World Cup scare before Suryakumar Yadav settles hosts
item.description: India is briefly left reeling at 6-67 against an underdog United States team, but captain Suryakumar Yadav helps the hosts avoid a horror start at the T20 World Cup.

item.title: Plane spotters call for dedicated aircraft viewing area at Adelaide Airport
item.description: Aviation enthusiasts gather at spots around Adelaide Airport to catch a glimpse of planes taking off and landing, but say it is becoming more difficult because of developments within and around the airport.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 day one quick hits: Mariah Carey accused of lip-syncing, Eileen Gu channels inner 'nerd'
item.description: A Finnish skier makes a questionable fashion choice on the slopes, while Mariah Carey faces claims she was lip-syncing at the opening ceremony. Here are the quick hits from the Winter Olympics.

item.title: How Jamie Pherous grew a travel giant, and exited amid an overcharging scandal
item.description: Australian travel mogul Jamie Pherous, who grew a three-man operation into a multi-billion dollar success, foundered on the rocks of an accounting scandal in the UK.

item.title: Elvis Smylie wins on LIV Golf debut in Saudi Arabia, holding off Jon Rahm under lights
item.description: Rising Australian star Elvis Smylie makes a dramatic mark on LIV Golf, winning his debut on the Saudi-backed tour in Riyadh under lights.

item.title: How a Canberra-based refugee fled the Maduro regime along with millions of other Venezuelans
item.description: Josh Madrid was arrested for attending a pro-democracy protest in Venezuela. 24 hours later, he fled his homeland, fearing he would be killed by the government.

item.title: Walking Tasmania's Overland Track — how it's changed over the years
item.description: Ron Preuss first walked the 65-kilometre-long Overland Track in 1987. Now, he returns decades later with his daughter Maren to see what has changed.

item.title: Coalition reunited after last-minute deal
item.description: The Liberals and Nationals have reached a breakthrough deal to reunite the Coalition after 11th-hour talks.

item.title: Heat and fires expose ancestral remains in Victoria's north-west
item.description: Ancestral remains that could be thousands of years old have been uncovered by erosion, dust storms and bushfires in Victoria.

item.title: Before opening Meg's Bookshop in 1991, the Arnolds were told kids 'didn't read' in Port Pirie
item.description: In one of Australia's most disadvantaged regions, more known for its lead than its literature, a couple wanted to open a book store but were told children didn't read books there. They did it anyway, and it went on to become a "world class" institution.

item.title: New Hobart zip-line proposal for public land, but this one wouldn't be on Kunanyi/Mount Wellington
item.description: Another zip-line is being proposed for public land near Hobart, almost a year after the last proposal on Kunanyi/Mt Wellington was knocked back by the Hobart City Council.

item.title: Queensland government announces hate speech reforms including banned slogans and symbols
item.description: The laws to be introduced in parliament this week will ban the phrases "globalise the intifada" and "from the river to the sea", as well as offensive symbols.

item.title: Authorities forced to evacuate 'oblivious' bush doof ravers during bushfire near Margaret River
item.description: Authorities are increasingly concerned with the fire risk posed by unsanctioned raves, known as bush doofs, held in WA's state forests and national parks.

item.title: Train delays in Italy during Winter Olympics opening weekend after damage
item.description: Police are investigating three incidents of damage on lines around Bologna, and have not ruled out a potential link to the Milan Cortina Games.

item.title: Jim Chalmers says next federal budget will focus on lifting economy's 'speed limit'
item.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says the federal government's budget in May will focus on productivity, spending restraint and tax reform.

item.title: Equine photography in demand in Australian performance horse industry
item.description: From leaf blowers to dance moves, photographers use every trick they can think of to get the perfect shot for the biggest performance-horse sale in the southern hemisphere.

item.title: Three people die, three others including child injured in car crash south of Brisbane
item.description: Two cars collided on Waterford Tamborine Road in Yarrabilba yesterday afternoon, leaving three people dead and three others with serious injuries.

item.title: Man dead, five others hospitalised after Sydney's Dreamstate music festival
item.description: Several people suffered "medical episodes" at the trance music festival at Sydney's Olympic Park, according to police.

item.title: New Zealanders hoped never to see the Christchurch terrorist again. Now he wants to appeal his sentence
item.description: Extraordinary arrangements are in place in Wellington, New Zealand, as a convicted terrorist prepares to address the country's Court of Appeal.

item.title: Piper James's parents say dingo management reform needed to prevent further deaths on K'gari
item.description: Piper James's parents are leaving Australia with their daughter's ashes and a determination to ensure she hasn't died in vain.

item.title: Palestine Action Group takes court action against extra police powers ahead of protests against Israeli president's Sydney visit
item.description: The Palestine Action Group lodged submissions late on Sunday afternoon, arguing the declaration was "draconian" and imposed rules unsuitable for protest activity.

item.title: Payne Haas quits Brisbane to sign three-year deal with South Sydney Rabbitohs
item.description: South Sydney have pulled off one of the biggest recruitment moves in NRL history after signing Brisbane enforcer Payne Haas to a three-year contract from 2027.

item.title: Tasmanian government says illegal tobacco sales crackdown will deliver some of the 'toughest' laws in the country
item.description: The Tasmanian government announces increased penalties for those caught selling illegal tobacco products.

item.title: In the Australian outback, we're listening for nuclear tests. What we hear matters more than ever
item.description: As the New START treaty curbing the US and Russian nuclear weapons programs expires, the work we do here in the red centre has become more important than ever before.

item.title: How did gold become so volatile? 8 Feb 2026
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: WA photographers reminisce about bygone Goldfields era as gold's price surges
item.description: In 1989, two photographers travelled from Fremantle to Western Australia's Goldfields to capture the end of a gold mining era.

item.title: Police recover pilot's body from croc-infested marsh after Normanton plane crash
item.description: Police officers armed with rifles guarded their colleagues while they recovered the man's body from the crash site in difficult terrain near Normanton, in the Gulf of Carpentaria.

item.title: SA Liberals promise new stamp duty concessions, Labor tackles aged care bed backlog
item.description: Less than six weeks from the South Australian election, the Liberal Party has announced an election promise on stamp duty while the Labor government unveil its plan to create 1,300 new aged care beds.

item.title: Century-old Forbes Inn Hotel gutted by fire
item.description: The Forbes Inn Hotel and nearby buildings were evacuated as crews worked to contain a fire at the pub early on Sunday morning.

item.title: Daly River flooding expected to reach 14m peak on Monday, as first damage to homes reported
item.description: Several homes in the remote community of Daly River have sustained minor flood damage, as waters continue to rise ahead of an expected 14m peak level on Monday.
